xxl.core.predicates
Class AnyPredicate<P>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.predicates.Predicate<P>
      xxl.core.predicates.AnyPredicate<P>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the predicate's parameters.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class AnyPredicate<P>
extends Predicate<P>

This class provides a prototypical implementation of the any-predicate. When the invoke method of this class is called, the given arguments will be applied to the subquery and it will be checked if any of the objects the subquery delivers satisfy the check condition.

For example consider the implementation of the query 

   SELECT (Integer2)
   FROM Cursor 2
   WHERE ANY Integer2 = (SELECT Integer1
                         FROM Cursor 1)
by using an AnyPredicate instance 
   System.out.println("Cursor 1: integers 11 to 19");
   Cursor<Integer> cursor1 = Cursors.wrap(new Enumerator(11,20));
   
   System.out.println("Cursor 2: integers 9 to 14");
   Cursor<Integer> cursor2 = Cursors.wrap(new Enumerator(9,15));
   
   Predicate<Integer> pred = new Equal<Integer>();
   
   Subquery<Integer> sub = new Subquery<Integer>(cursor1, null, null);
   
   Predicate<Integer> any0 = new AnyPredicate<Integer>(sub, pred, Arrays.asList(1));
   
   Filter<Integer> cursor = new Filter<Integer>(cursor2, any0);
   
   System.out.println("Cursor: result");
   
   Cursors.println(cursor);

See Also:

public boolean invoke(List<? extends P> arguments)
When the invoke method is called, the given arguments will be applied to the subquery and it will be checked if any of the objects the subquery delivers satisfy the check condition.

Overrides:
invoke in class Predicate<P>
Parameters:
arguments - the arguments to be applied to the underlying predicate.
Returns:
the result of the underlying predicate's invoke method that is called with applied arguments.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples of how to use an AnyPredicate. It can also be used to test the functionality of the AnyPredicate.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
